p2: Fill in your business details in the header section, including company name, address, and contact information. Enter client information, invoice number, and dates. Add line items by clicking the add button—each item includes description, quantity, unit price, and automatic subtotal calculation. Set the tax rate percentage and select your currency from supported options. The invoice total updates automatically as you add items or adjust tax. Preview the formatted invoice, then either print directly from your browser or save as PDF using your browser's print-to-PDF function. Your invoice data never leaves your device.
p3: Freelancers generate professional invoices for client projects without purchasing expensive accounting software. Small business owners create invoices on-the-go from any device without installing desktop applications. Consultants bill hourly work across multiple projects with itemized descriptions. Service providers document one-time jobs with clear payment terms and line item breakdowns. Independent contractors maintain professional documentation for tax purposes. Event organizers invoice clients for services, equipment rentals, and labor as separate line items with transparent pricing.
p4: Include your payment terms (e.g., "Net 30") and accepted payment methods in the notes section for clarity. Assign sequential invoice numbers using a consistent format like "INV-2026-001" for easy tracking and professional appearance. For recurring clients, save common line items as templates in a text file for quick copy-paste. Double-check tax calculations manually when working across tax jurisdictions. Set the payment due date strategically—shorter payment windows improve cash flow. Before sending, preview the PDF to ensure all information fits on one page for easier printing by clients.
p5: The tool calculates subtotals and tax amounts using JavaScript decimal arithmetic to avoid floating-point precision errors. Multiple currency symbols are supported including USD, EUR, GBP, and others. The invoice layout follows standard business invoice formats with clearly separated sections for sender, recipient, and line items. Print stylesheets ensure the invoice renders cleanly on PDF without browser UI elements. Tax is calculated as a percentage of the pre-tax subtotal and displayed as a separate line item before the final total.
